text: black beans are a super healthy super
convenient pantry staple to have on hand
and if you pair it with brown rice you
have a complete plant-based protein on
your hands and a super cheap delicious
meal so I'm going to start by cooking my
black means I have one pound of black
beans that I've picked over just make
sure you don't have any twigs or
anything in them add that to medium pot
we're going to add a bay leaf for flavor
and then generous amount of water we're
looking for about three inches of water
above the beans bring this to a boil and
then we'll reduce it to a simmer let
this cook for about 1 and 1/2 hours
until it's very tender now a very
important part of being cookery is to
season it and not just season it at the
end season it from the beginning this
way it has all the flavor right at the
start so we'll let this come up to a
boil and then we'll reduce okay so my
beans have come up to a boil we're going
to reduce the heat and let this simmer
for about an hour and a half until the
beans are meltingly tender so it's been
about an hour and a half we're going to
drain this mixture but reserve four cups
of the cooking liquid that's going to
help add body to our finished dish so I

bring out all the flavor you can smell
it already it smells wonderful
I think whole cumin seeds are really

not least the star of the show one

give that a stir
season with a little bit of salt to help

tender about 6 minutes or so right so
the veg are nice and tender let's add

so we're going to give this a stir
and let this simmer for about 20 minutes
or so the sauce is gonna thicken up a

these look great here give it a stir now
great thing about this recipe is you can
